page.title: 12Nature Conservation
page.content:
The children of Colerne Primary School are very keen on Conservation in our area. In 1982 one class dug out a school pond in a waste ground area. We put a polythene lining in. The polythene lining worked well for two years, when it started to split.
Everyone in the school planted some trees in the Conservation Area.They included hazel, beech and oak. Quite a few of the trees survived. We also planted some wild flowers and chose ones to attract butterflies.
In the end of 1984 we cemented the pond.We stood the water in buckets over night and then in the morning we emptied the water into the pond.We drained the water out of the pond and then filled it up again. The pond now has a variety of pond creatures.
